page.title: 11The History of Himbleton
page.content: Thomas Habingdon the 17th century Worcestershire historian said of Himbleton "She is well watered - if not too much in winter". He spoke of Bow Brook and nearly 400 years later she is still too well watered by the floods of Bow Brook. The Church is dedicated to St.Mary Magdalene. A small part of the south wall is 12th century but the main buldding dates from the 14th and following 4 cunturies. Until 1976 Himbleton had its own Vicar , but now shares with Crowle and the Vicarage was sold. Other antiquities are the pack-horse bridge at Shell Ford and nearby Shell Manor,Shell Mill and farmhouse. There are many "black & white"buildings. The surrounding woods are the remnants of Feckenham Forest.
